title: If you don't finish listening to a song on Spotify do the artists still get paid and does Spotify track this behavior? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you listen to at least 30 seconds of the track, the artist will receive royalties. If you don’t listen to at least 30 seconds of the track, the artist will not. If the track is less than 30 seconds, even if you listen to the entire track the artist will not receive royalties. 30 seconds is the minimum amount of listening required for Spotify to count it as one “listen” for the sake of money. By listening I mean the song has to play for 30 seconds. It can be on mute, max volume, or via headphones, it doesn’t matter.

Yes. The moment the song is launched, the music service has to pay. Unless Spotify has some unique deal in place, they have to pay regardless of whether the user finishes the song or not. Hence the reason some services limit your skipping.
